ch.fhnw.imvs.smartcard

Class CommandAPDU

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.fhnw.imvs.smartcard.CommandAPDU

  • public class CommandAPDU
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a Command APDU created out of a bytearray. This class provides methods to check an APDUs validity and to access the fields. Standard and Extended Length APDUs are supported.

    Overview over APDUs

    CLA INS P1 P2 Lc Data Le
    Header (required) Body (optional)

    APDUs consist of two Parts:

    • Header: 4 bytes, required.
    • Body: Variable length, optional.

    The header consists of four Bytes:

    • CLA: Command Class.
    • INS: Instruction.
    • P1: Parameter 1
    • P2: Parameter 2

    The body is of variable length, depending on the APDU Case and if it's a Standard or an Extended APDU. The Fields in the body have the following meanings:

    • Lc: Length of the Data field. Length is 1 byte for Standard APDUs and 3 bytes for Extended APDUs. Default Value is 0 (No Data present)
    • Data: Application specific Argument Data. Length is stored in the Lc field.
    • Le: Maximum length of answer. Length is 1 byte for Standard APDUs, 2 bytes for Extended APDUs if the Lc field is present and 3 byts for Extended APDUs if the Lc field is not present. Default is 0 (No answer expected). The explicitly set value 0 is interpreted as 256 (For Standard APDUs) or 65536 (For Extended APDUs)

    There are four types of Command APDUs:

    • Case 1: No body. (APDU Length: 4 bytes)
    • Case 2: Only the Le field is present in the body. (APDU Length: 5 bytes for Standard APDUs and 7 bytes for Extended APDUs)
    • Case 3: The Lc and the Data fields are present in the body. (APDU Length: 5 bytes + Data Length for Standard APDUs and 7 bytes + Data Length for Extended APDUs)
    • Case 4: The Lc, the Data and te Le fields are present in the body. (APDU Length: 6 bytes + Data Length for Standard APDUs and 9 bytes + Data Length for Extended APDUs)

    The Function boolean isValidAPDU() returns true only if all the rules above are followed. If the APDU isn't valid, the behaviour of the class isn't specified (This includes exceptions).

      CommandAPDU(byte[] data)
      Creates a CommandAPDU object out of the raw bytes of an APDU.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getArgumentData()
      Returns the Argument Data of this APDU.
      byte getCla()
      Returns the CLA byte of the header of this APDU.
      byte getIns()
      Returns the INS byte of the header of this APDU.
      int getLc()
      Returns the Value of the Lc field of this APDU if present, or 0 otherwise.
      int getLe()
      Returns the Value of the Le field of this APDU, or -1 if not present.
      byte getP1()
      Returns the P1 byte of the header of this APDU.

      Returns the P2 byte of the header of this APDU.

      Returns a Copy of the underlying bytearray.

      Returns whether the Data field is present in this APDU.
      boolean isExtendedAPDU()
      Returns whether this APDU uses the extended format.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidAPDU

        public boolean isValidAPDU()
        Checks if the APDU is valid. Checks for each of the case types if the length fields are set correctly and in accordance with the length of the bytearray.
        Returns:
        true if the APDU is a correct APDU according to the standards definition, false otherwise.

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Returns whether the Data field is present in this APDU.
        Returns:
        true if the APDU contains a Data field, false otherwise.

      • getCla

        public byte getCla()
        Returns the CLA byte of the header of this APDU.
        Returns:
        the Class byte of this APDU.

      • getIns

        public byte getIns()
        Returns the INS byte of the header of this APDU.
        Returns:
        the Instruction byte of this APDU.

      • getP1

        public byte getP1()
        Returns the P1 byte of the header of this APDU.
        Returns:
        the Parameter 1 byte of this APDU.

      • getP2

        public byte getP2()
        Returns the P2 byte of the header of this APDU.
        Returns:
        the Parameter 2 byte of this APDU.

      • getLe

        public int getLe()
        Returns the Value of the Le field of this APDU, or -1 if not present. The interpretation depends on whether this is a Standard or an Extended APDU.
        Returns:
        Value of the Le field or -1 if not present. 0 is to be interpreted as 65536 (Extended APDU) or 256 (Standard APDU), see boolean isExtendedAPDU().

      • getLc

        public int getLc()
        Returns the Value of the Lc field of this APDU if present, or 0 otherwise.
        Returns:
        Value of the Lc-Field or 0 if not present.

      • getArgumentData

        public byte[] getArgumentData()
        Returns the Argument Data of this APDU.
        Returns:
        byte[] with the length getLc(), filled with the Argument Data. If no Argument Data is present, an empty bytearray is returned.

      • isExtendedAPDU

        public boolean isExtendedAPDU()
        Returns whether this APDU uses the extended format.
        Returns:
        true if this APDU uses the extended length field notation, false otherwise.

      • getRaw

        public byte[] getRaw()
        Returns a Copy of the underlying bytearray.
        Returns:
        A Copy of the byte[]-Representation of this APDU.
